Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: We are given a normative process description and an event log with 5 cases We need to identify which cases violate the normative process and explain the violations First lets summarize the normative process rules as clearly as possible The process always begins with Receive order Next Check inventory must occur before any decisions about payment authorization or fulfillment Two main branches If inventory is sufficient After Check inventory proceed to Authorize payment then Package items then Ship order then Close order So sequence Receive Check Authorize Package Ship Close If inventory is insufficient After Check inventory proceed to Cancel order then Close order So sequence Receive Check Cancel Close Specific constraints Authorize payment should only occur after Check inventory and before packaging Package items should only occur after authorization and before shipping Ship order should only occur after packaging and never after a cancellation Close order should be the final activity in all scenarios Violations shipping after cancellation authorizing payment before checking inventory packaging items before authorization etc

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now we examine each case Case 1 Activities Receive order Check inventory Authorize payment Package items Ship order Close order This follows the sufficient inventory branch exactly No violation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 Activities Receive order Check inventory Package items Authorize payment Ship order Close order Here Package items occurs before Authorize payment According to the rules Package items should only occur after authorization So this is a violation Also the normative description says Package items should only occur after authorization and before shipping So packaging before authorization is not allowed Additionally it says Authorize payment should only occur after Check inventory and before packaging Here authorization occurs after packaging so that might also be a violation of the intended order authorization before packaging So Case 2 violates the process

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Case 3 Activities Receive order Check inventory Authorize payment Cancel order Ship order Close order This case is interesting It starts like the sufficient branch with Authorize payment after Check inventory but then it goes to Cancel order According to the description if inventory is insufficient we go directly from Check inventory to Cancel order without Authorize payment But here Authorize payment occurs before Cancel The description says if the inventory check reveals that there is not enough stock to fulfill the order the process must branch into a cancellation scenario In such a case after checking the inventory the process should directly proceed to Cancel order That implies that if we cancel we should not authorize payment So having Authorize payment before Cancel is a deviation Also after Cancel we have Ship order The description explicitly says Ship order should only occur after packaging and never after a cancellation So shipping after cancellation is a violation Additionally note that there is no Package items before Ship order which is also required for shipping So multiple violations Authorize payment before cancellation in a cancellation scenario or perhaps the scenario is inconsistent we authorized payment but then canceled which might be allowed The description says payment authorization only makes sense once inventory sufficiency is known If inventory is sufficient we shouldnt cancel if insufficient we shouldnt authorize So authorizing and then canceling is not in the normative description It might be a deviation if inventory was initially thought sufficient but then something else caused cancellation

Name: Validation - PE
Text: But the description doesnt cover that it assumes cancellation is due to insufficient inventory So we interpret strictly after check inventory if insufficient go to cancel if sufficient go to authorize So here after check we have authorize which implies inventory was sufficient but then cancel is not part of the sufficient branch So its a violation Shipping after cancellation is explicitly forbidden Shipping without packaging is also a violation So Case 3 violates

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 4 Activities Receive order Check inventory Cancel order Close order This follows the insufficient inventory branch exactly No violation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 5 Activities Receive order Check inventory Authorize payment Ship order Close order Missing Package items between Authorize payment and Ship order The description says Package items should only occur after authorization and before shipping So shipping should occur only after packaging Here we have no packaging activity so shipping directly after authorization is a violation Also the normative sequence for sufficient inventory requires packaging before shipping So Case 5 violates

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Thus violating cases 2 3 and 5 Case 1 and 4 are correct Now we need to explain the violations for each violating case Lets write the answer
